main event: On October 31, 1955, three bright lights were observed at an estimated altitude of 5,000 feet and an estimated speed of 700 miles per hour near Stephenville, Newfoundland.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 5 minutes without radar contact,No jets were reported in the area at the time of the observation,The lights were described as extremely bright,The sighting was evaluated as possibly being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical factors,The observer indicated that they had seen similar objects in the area before.
witness description: observer has previously seen similar objects in the area
